0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Isotope static scan lymph node, draining a primary tumor in patients with breast cancer or malignant melanoma: 3.7 to 37 megabecquerel (0.1 to 1 millicurie) in 0.1 to 1 mL SUBQ
  • Peritoneal venous shunt patency test for Leveen shunt: 37 to 111 megabecquerel (1 to 3 millicurie) by INTRAPERITONEAL injection, or 12 to 37 megabecquerel (0.3 to 1 millicurie) in 0.5 mL or less by PERCUTANEOUS TRANSTUBAL INJECTION (efferent limb)
  • Radioisotope study of hematopoietic system, reticuloendothelial cell function in liver, spleen and bone marrow: (liver or spleen imaging) 37 to 296 megabecquerels (1 to 8 millicurie) by IV injection
  • Radioisotope study of hematopoietic system, reticuloendothelial cell function in liver, spleen and bone marrow: (bone marrow imaging) 111 to 444 megabecquerels (3 to 12 millicurie) by IV injection
  • Radionuclide esophageal study, for esophageal transit or gastroesophageal reflux: 5.55 to 11.1 megabecquerel (0.15 to 0.3 millicurie) ORALLY
  • Radionuclide imaging of lung for pulmonary aspiration: 11.1 to 18.5 megabecquerel (0.3 to 0.5 millicurie) ORALLY

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• safety and efficacy not established for uses other than imaging areas of functioning reticuloendothelial cells, gastroesophageal or pulmonary aspiration studies
  • Radioisotope study of hematopoietic system, reticuloendothelial cell function in liver, spleen and bone marrow: (liver or spleen imaging, children) 0.56 to 2.78 megabecquerel (0.015 to 0.075 millicurie)/kg body weight by IV injection
  • Radioisotope study of hematopoietic system, reticuloendothelial cell function in liver, spleen and bone marrow: (liver or spleen imaging, newborns) 7.4 to 18.5 megabecquerel (0.2 to 0.5 millicurie) by IV injection
  • Radioisotope study of hematopoietic system, reticuloendothelial cell function in liver, spleen and bone marrow: (bone marrow imaging) 1.11 to 5.55 megabecquerel (0.03 to 0.15 millicurie)/kg body weight by IV injection
  • Radionuclide esophageal study, for esophageal transit or gastroesophageal reflux: 3.7 to 11.1 megabecquerel (0.1 to 0.3 millicurie) ORALLY or by NASOGASTRIC tube
  • Radionuclide imaging of lung for pulmonary aspiration: 3.7 to 11.1 megabecquerel (0.1 to 0.3 millicurie) ORALLY or by NASOGASTRIC tube

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Isotope static scan lymph node, draining a primary tumor in patients with breast cancer or malignant melanoma
  • Peritoneal venous shunt patency test for Leveen shunt
  • Radioisotope study of hematopoietic system, reticuloendothelial cell function in liver, spleen and bone marrow
  • Radionuclide esophageal study, for esophageal transit or gastroesophageal reflux
  • Radionuclide imaging of lung for pulmonary aspiration

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• anaphylactic reactions (eg, bronchospasm, hypotension, urticaria), including rare fatalities, have been reported;
  • cancer risk may be increased, especially in children; use smallest dose necessary
  • high doses (greater than 370 megabecquerels or 10 milliCuries); patients should minimize close contact with infants for 6 or more hours after administration
  • nursing mothers should express and discard breast milk for at least 6 hours after injection
  • pregnancy; may cause fetal harm; assess status in women of reproductive potential within 48 hours before administering
  • radiopharmaceutical; handle with care, maintain adequate shielding of final preparation, and use safety measures to reduce radiation exposure to personnel and patient
  • report suspected adverse reactions to the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono:
• AAP: Radioactive compounds that require temporary cessation of breastfeeding.
  • WHO: Avoid breastfeeding.
  • Micromedex: Milk effects are possible.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Technetium Tc 99m sulfur colloid is a radioactive pharmaceutical agent for use in diagnostic imaging

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
General Information
  • do not administer directly to patient; proper preparation is required
  • do not use sodium pertechnetate Tc 99m containing oxidants for reconstitution
  • do not use sodium pertechnetate Tc 99m containing more than 10 mcg/mL of aluminum ion for reconstitution due to risk of precipitation that may localize in the lung
  • wear waterproof gloves during preparation
  • remove cap from sulfur colloid multidose reaction vial; complete radiation label and affix to vial; place vial in an appropriate lead-capped radiation shield
  • use a sterile shielded syringe to add 1 to 3 mL sodium pertechnetate Tc 99m to sulfur colloid reaction vial
  • place a lead cover on vial shield; swirl gently
  • just prior to use remove cap from Solution A; aseptically withdraw 1.5 mL, inject into reaction vial and swirl
  • transfer reaction vial from vial shield to a vigorously boiling water bath (shield water bath with 1/8 to 1/4 inch lead) deep enough to cover vial contents; leave in water bath 5 minutes
  • remove reaction vial from water bath, place in lead shield, cool 3 minutes
  • just before use, remove cap from Solution B; aseptically withdraw 1.5 mL, inject into reaction vial and swirl
  • record time and date
  • allow to cool to body temperature before use; maintain adequate shielding at all times
  • if needed, dilute with sterile sodium chloride injection to achieve dosage within recommended range
  • withdraw dose with a sterile shielded syringe; use within 6 hours of preparation; minimize time for best results
  • agitate shielded syringe immediately prior to administration to avoid particle aggregation and non-uniform radioactivity distribution
  • measure dose by radioactivity calibration system immediately before administration; check radiochemical purity
  • discard 6 hours after reconstitution

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: image quality of lymph nodes, peritoneo-venous shunt patency, reticuloendothelial cells in liver, spleen, or bone marrow, esophageal transit, or pulmonary aspirates is indicative of efficacy

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause rash, urticaria, anaphylactic shock, hypotension, or a burning sensation at the injection site.
  • Tell patients to notify their healthcare provider if they are breastfeeding or intend to breastfeed during or around the time of therapy; instruct lactating patients to express and discard milk for at least 6 hours after the injection.
